meanings.definition: The quality or state of being indomitable.
meanings.sent1: Her indomitablenesses shone through as she faced every challenge with unwavering determination.
meanings.sent2: The indomitablenesses of the hero inspired others to never give up.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the kitten's indomitablenesses in chasing after the big dog was both brave and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The indomitablenesses of the ocean waves crashing against the shore reminded me of the unstoppable force of nature.
meanings.sent5: The indomitablenesses of the sun rising every morning is a powerful symbol of resilience and strength.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being impossible to subdue or defeat.
meanings.sent1: The indomitablenesses of the fortress made it impervious to any attack.
meanings.sent2: His indomitablenesses in the face of adversity earned him the respect of all who knew him.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's indomitablenesses in protecting its acorns from other animals was both impressive and amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The indomitablenesses of the mountain stood tall and undefeated against the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The indomitablenesses of a mother's love knows no bounds and is unmatched in its strength.
